alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oklahoma County through 700 PM CDT... At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nicoma Park, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastern Oklahoma City, Midwest City, Del City, Choctaw, Harrah, Spencer, Jones, Nicoma Park and Tinker Air Force Base. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 159 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
